Nanu’s taxi 
 Marion Drew 
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Helo! My name is Nanu. I am waiting with my mother for a taxi. We 
 
 are going home. 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Here I am standing in line. My mother sings me a song. 
 
 “Come Mr Taxi can’t you se? We are waiting, Nanu and me!” 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The lady next to me is taking her chickens home. They wil lay egs 
 
 for her to eat. 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 These men are coming back from work. They smile at me. I hear 
 
 them sing, “Hey litle Nanu, don’t you wory. Taxi’s coming in a hury.” 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 A lady walks past. She is a very smart lady. Aren’t her shoes 
 
 beautiful? They go “click, click, click…click, click, click…” when she 
 
 walks. 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 This man is seling cold drinks. I love cold drinks. They are so cold 
 
 and swet. Do you like them? 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Lok! There are ladies taking their super home on their heads. Aren’t 
 
 they clever? 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 That lady is having her hair done. She is going out with her friends 
 
 tonight. 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 I am tired now. My mother puts me on her back where I can rest. She 
 
 sings, “Please Mr Taxi, don’t be late, Gogo is waiting at our gate.” 
 
 
 9  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 There is my friend Tumi. He is also resting. We wil be home son. 
 
 
 
 10  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 High up there the birds are flying home. They must get home before it 
 
 is dark. 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 This lady has beautiful earings. I think she bought them in town 
 
 today. When I grow up I wil buy many earings for me and my mother. 
 
 
 12  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 My mother is geting tired now. I sing her a song, “Please Mr Taxi, 
 
 won’t you come, we are waiting, me and mum.” 
 
 
 13  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Wait! I can hear the taxi! Here it comes! 
 
 
 
 14  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 This is our big red taxi. It has come to take me and my mother home. 
 
 I am very hapy! 
 
 
 15  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Godbye! 
 
 
 
 16
